issue.title: Incorrect treatment of rdbuf()->close() return type

discussion.p: I just spotted a minor problem in 27.8.1.7 [lib.ifstream.members] para 4 and also 27.8.1.13 [lib.fstream.members] para 4. In both places it says:

blockquote.p: Effects: Calls rdbuf()->close() and, if that function returns false, ...

discussion.p: However, basic_filebuf::close() (27.8.1.2) returns a pointer to the filebuf on success, null on failure, so I think it is meant to say "if that function returns a null pointer". Oddly, it is correct for basic_ofstream.

blockquote.p: Effects: Calls rdbuf()->close() and, if that function fails (returns false a null pointer), calls setstate(failbit) (which may throw ios_base::failure (27.4.4.3)).
Effects: Calls rdbuf()->close() and, if that function fails (returns false a null pointer), calls setstate(failbit) (which may throw ios_base::failure (27.4.4.3)).
